page.title: 07BRANCOTE FARM
page.content: The farm owns 463 cattle and grows wheat,barley and potatoes.The dairy cows are British Fresian and the steers are Hereford Cross.The farmer owns and manages 342 hectares and rents a further 10 hectares.Twenty years ago everything was done by hand but now there are many items of machinery including tractors,trailers,a milking machine,harrows,rollers and a fork lift truck. Hay,straw and second grade potatoes are fed to the animals.Milk and crops are sold.Grain goes to the highest bidder.Milk is priced by it's quality and the farmer gets 15p compared with a doorstep price of 22p a pint. The farm was bought for 3000 pounds 20 years ago but is now worth 1,500,000 pounds.The staff work from 8:30am till 5pm with 90 minutes for lunch,but sometimes work until 8pm carting hay.
